character.name: Raj

appearance.build: average height, slightly stooped posture from age
appearance.eyes: warm brown eyes behind thick-framed rectangular glasses
appearance.distinguishing_features: thick-framed rectangular glasses, age spots on hands, warm gentle smile, slightly stooped posture

character.occupation: Retired electrical engineer (worked at Bell Labs for 35 years). Enjoys a leisurely retirement.
character.living_situation: Two-story suburban house in Edison, New Jersey (large Indian American community) with wife Sunita (69, retired school teacher). Adult children live elsewhere.
character.transportation: Silver Toyota Camry. Daily walks with dog Buddy around the neighborhood.

style.sleep: Light blue cotton kurta pajama (traditional Indian sleepwear)
style.morning_home: White undershirt (banian) with loose cotton pants, house slippers. Cardigan or light sweater if cool.
style.going_out: Collared polo shirt or button-down, khaki pants, walking shoes, light jacket
style.puja: Clean kurta, sometimes a small tilak on forehead

family.wife: Sunita, 69 years, retired school teacher, warm face, gray-streaked dark hair often in a bun, wears salwar kameez at home
family.son: Vikram, 42, lives in California, software engineer
family.daughter: Priya, 38, lives in nearby Princeton, pediatrician

notes.educational_context: This character represents a retired Indian American man living in Edison, New Jersey. Shows suburban elderly life, Indian American cultural traditions blended with American daily routines, pet care, gardening, and community involvement.
notes.cultural_context: Indian American community in Edison NJ, Hindu prayer traditions (puja), chai culture, Indian cuisine (paratha, dal, curry), cricket fandom, Hindi/English bilingual household, community center activities
notes.pedagogical_goal: Teach vocabulary related to elderly daily routines, pet care (dog), gardening, Indian American food and culture, suburban home life, retirement activities, and family relationships
notes.language_notes: Some Hindi terms naturally used: puja (prayer), chai (tea), kurta (tunic shirt), banian (undershirt), paratha (flatbread), dal (lentils), namaste (greeting), beta (term of endearment for child/young person)
